comment: Is the rest of the lecture posted? If it is can u tell which one is it? Thanks
Do brain cells regenerate at all? ;-)
Dyang, why is your channel not getting the views? You are damn underrated. You are a blessing to many bio major students like us. Thank you for this❣️
This lecture covers the entire cell cycle chapter. Is there a particular topic you are looking for? Let me know and I can guide you towards the lecture that would contain it.

Yes, ofcourse, brain cells do regenerate as well but at a lot slower rate and in limited manner compared to other parts of the body. Neuroplasticity is much higher in babies and young children and they are able to deal with brain injury or issues better because of higher regeneration rate at that time. However, it becomes more limited as we grow older. Here is a cool article on this topic. https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fcell.2021.649891/full#:~:text=As%20with%20most%20tissues%20in,injury%20(Modo%2C%202019).

Thank you for your kind comments. I am relatively new at this. I started it as a way to provide online lectures to my students during COVID. However, now I am posting more to grow the channel as well. If you find my content helpful, please share with your friends/ peers and recommend it to them as well.
